docs.lead_paragraph: In the Dominican Republic, boys are routinely receiving injections of over-the-counter vitamins and painkillers.

headline.seo: Dominican Baseball Handlers Stir Issues of Exploiting Youths
headline.main: Dominicans Try Shots to Boost Rising Players
headline.print_headline: Dominicans Try Shots to Boost Rising Players

byline.contributor: Robert Gebeloff, Andrew Keh and Elena Gustines contributed reporting from New York.

docs.lead_paragraph: 9 P.M. (13, 49) ENDGAMEWilliam Hurt portrays Prof. Will Esterhuyse, the leader of an unofficial delegation representing white South Africa, and Chiwetel Ejiofor, above left, is Thabo Mbeki, the head of a group of exiles from the African National Congress (and the country's future president), in this ''Masterpiece Contemporary'' presentation. Based on ''The Fall of Apartheid'' by Robert Harvey, the film is set in the bleak mid-1980s, as civil war loomed. Jonny Lee Miller plays Michael Young, a public affairs specialist for Consolidated Gold Fields, who, despite the fact that his company has long benefited from apartheid, argues that economic and political chaos will result if the racist system is not dismantled. Derek Jacobi is the company's chairman, who agrees to finance Young's mission, and Clarke Peters is Nelson Mandela. Pete Travis directed this real-life political thriller; Paula Milne wrote the screenplay. 9 A.M. (CNN) STATE OF THE UNION WITH JOHN KING The Afghan presidential candidate Abdullah Abdullah discusses the coming runoff here and on ''Fox News Sunday With Chris Wallace'' on Fox at 10.

docs.lead_paragraph: As part of an investigation into donations made by nonprofit groups to politicians, the state attorney general, Andrew M. Cuomo, has ordered dozens of charities to take back illegal contributions -- or lose their tax-exempt status, The New York Post reports.

headline.main: Nonprofits Ordered to Take Back Political Donations
